subject: Negotiation
title: Building a Negotiation Reputation
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Building a Negotiation Reputation.

hook.text: Warren Buffett closes billion-dollar deals with a handshake. His reputation earns that trust.

buildup.text: Your reputation precedes every negotiation. People talk before you sit down.

discovery.text: Negotiators known as fair and creative get better deals because others want to work with them.

twist.text: It takes years to build a reputation and one bad deal to destroy it.

climax.text: Every negotiation is an audition for the next one â€” people remember how you made them feel.

punchline.text: Your reputation is your longest-running deal.

quiz.question: Why do fair negotiators get better deals over time?
options: Others want to work with them and offer more
They trick people into thinking they're fair
